title: Charge separation on charged and neutral rods

content.question: Two metal rods are held far apart. The left rod has a net positive charge that is evenly distributed along its outer surfaces, and the right rod is uncharged, as shown in the figure. Which of the following best shows the charges on the rods after they have been brought near each other?

choices.label: The figure presents a diagram of two horizontal rods. The rod on the left has 8 positive charges evenly distributed across the rod, and the rod on the right is uncharged. A note indicates that the figure is not drawn to scale.

The figure presents a diagram of two horizontal rods. The rod on the left has 8 positive charges evenly distributed across the center and righthand portions of the rod. The rod on the right has 2 negative charges located on the lefthand side of the rod.

The figure presents a diagram of two horizontal rods. The rod on the left has 8 positive charges evenly distributed across the center and righthand portions of the rod. The rod on the right has 2 negative charges located on the lefthand side of the rod and 2 positive charges located on the righthand side of the rod.

The figure presents a diagram of two horizontal rods. The rod on the left has 8 positive charges evenly distributed across the center and lefthand portions of the rod. The rod on the right has 2 positive charges located on the lefthand side of the rod and 2 negative charges located on the righthand side of the rod.

content.answer: The figure presents a diagram of two horizontal rods. The rod on the left has 8 positive charges evenly distributed across the center and righthand portions of the rod. The rod on the right has 2 negative charges located on the lefthand side of the rod and 2 positive charges located on the righthand side of the rod.
